stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Four Phishing Email Campaigns Utilize Blackhole Landing Pages
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: Between 03 JULY 2013 and 25 JULY 2013, an organization has observed 4 separate Blackhole phishing email campaigns. The themes of the emails are reservation, fax, and payment focused. One of the emails contains a malicious .ZIP file that calls out to a domain, while the remaining three emails contain links to Blackhole landing pages.

This file is a ZBOT trojan. When executed, the .ZIP file installs the trojan and calls out to several command and control domains:
fj-p.com moheet.com firefoxchina.cn
This domain is associated with the ZBOT trojan.
This domain is associated with the ZBOT trojan.
This domain is associated with the ZBOT trojan.

This email contains multiple links to a Blackhole exploit landing page. The subject line of these phishing emails all begin with "Houston Marriott Westchase Reservation Confirmation". The 8-digits at the end of the subject line (which are also the confirmation number in the email) appear to be random.
During the same time period, other emails were observed with the same look and feel, but with different links pointing to the following domains:
kreitner.at protectia-muncii-timis.ro viperlair.net nycgovparks.org

The "Caller-ID" and reference numbers listed in the email appear to be randomly generated including the number of pages in the title. Other examples of subject lines include "Corporate eFax message - 1 pages". During the same time period, other emails were observed with the same general theme, but with different links pointing to the following domains/IP addresses:
comcastbiz.net teamkb.de 208.109.168.74 imeponline.org

This domain has been observed hosting Blackhole exploit landing pages.

This email attempts to trick the user into thinking they have received a fax. The sender/header information was spoofed to appear to originate from an administrator within the organization. Virtually all numbers in the email, including the 10 digits in the subject line, appear to be randomly generated and no two samples submitted were identical. Another example of a subject line is: "INCOMING FAX REPORT : Remote ID: 3410950062".
There is one malicious link at the bottom of the email taking the user to a Blackhole landing page. During the same time period, other emails were observed with the same theme, but with different links pointing to the following domains:
ledribbon.ca digitalboilermaker.com prodeloc.com shockalocka.com gf.dentalsoftwareadvisor.com impresiona2.net topseoseobestpractices.com christinegreenmd.com venustoys.net ente-gmbh.de
